trans-unit.source: How to deploy a SQL Database to SQL Azure
trans-unit.target: How to deploy a SQL Database to SQL Azure

trans-unit.source: Deploy a SQL Server database to Azure SQL Database using the Wizard in SQL Server 2016 Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: Deploy a SQL Server database to Azure SQL Database using the Wizard in SQL Server 2016 Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you'll use the Deploy Database to Azure SQL Database wizard to upload a sample database to Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you'll use the Deploy Database to Azure SQL Database wizard to upload a sample database to Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: You must download SQL Server 2016 Management Studio (CTP 2.1) for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You must download SQL Server 2016 Management Studio (CTP 2.1) for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Estimated time to completion: 15 minutes (includes download time)
trans-unit.target: Estimated time to completion: 15 minutes (includes download time)

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses a "school" sample database that is purposefully simple; all of its objects are compatible with Azure SQL Database, eliminating the need to modify or prepare the database for migration.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses a "school" sample database that is purposefully simple; all of its objects are compatible with Azure SQL Database, eliminating the need to modify or prepare the database for migration.

trans-unit.source: If you are migrating a more complex existing database, you could also consider using the <linkText>SQL Database Migration Wizard</linkText><title></title> and see this <linkText>overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are migrating a more complex existing database, you could also consider using the <linkText>SQL Database Migration Wizard</linkText><title></title> and see this <linkText>overview</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A Microsoft Azure account.
trans-unit.target: A Microsoft Azure account.

trans-unit.source: For a free trial, see this <linkText>offer</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a free trial, see this <linkText>offer</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Download [SQL Server Management Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt238290.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Download [SQL Server Management Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt238290.aspx).

trans-unit.source: (For more information about the tool, see <linkText>SQL Server Management Studio - June 2015 Release Notes</linkText><title></title>.)
trans-unit.target: (For more information about the tool, see <linkText>SQL Server Management Studio - June 2015 Release Notes</linkText><title></title>.)

trans-unit.source: An existing Azure SQL Database server.
trans-unit.target: An existing Azure SQL Database server.

trans-unit.source: In order to create a server, you must create at least one database first.
trans-unit.target: In order to create a server, you must create at least one database first.

trans-unit.source: When you create a database, you have the choice of creating it on a new server, or on an existing server.
trans-unit.target: When you create a database, you have the choice of creating it on a new server, or on an existing server.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on creating a new database (on a new server), see <linkText>Create your first Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on creating a new database (on a new server), see <linkText>Create your first Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Run these scripts in SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) to create an on-premises version of the "school" database.
trans-unit.target: Run these scripts in SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) to create an on-premises version of the "school" database.

trans-unit.source: In SSMS, connect to an on-premises server.
trans-unit.target: In SSMS, connect to an on-premises server.

trans-unit.source: Right-click Databases, click New Database, and enter school.
trans-unit.target: Right-click Databases, click New Database, and enter school.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on school, click New Query.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on school, click New Query.

trans-unit.source: Copy and execute this script:
trans-unit.target: Copy and execute this script:

trans-unit.source:
-- Create the Department table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[Department]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Department]( [DepartmentID] [int] NOT NULL, [Name] [nvarchar](50) NOT NULL, [Budget] [money] NOT NULL, [StartDate] [datetime] NOT NULL, [Administrator] [int] NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_Department] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [DepartmentID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Create the Person table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[Person]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Person]( [PersonID] [int] IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL, [LastName] [nvarchar](50) NOT NULL, [FirstName] [nvarchar](50) NOT NULL, [HireDate] [datetime] NULL, [EnrollmentDate] [datetime] NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_School.Student] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [PersonID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Create the OnsiteCourse table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[OnsiteCourse]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[OnsiteCourse]( [CourseID] [int] NOT NULL, [Location] [nvarchar](50) NOT NULL, [Days] [nvarchar](50) NOT NULL, [Time] [smalldatetime] NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_OnsiteCourse] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [CourseID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Create the OnlineCourse table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[OnlineCourse]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[OnlineCourse]( [CourseID] [int] NOT NULL, [URL] [nvarchar](100) NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_OnlineCourse] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [CourseID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
--Create the StudentGrade table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[StudentGrade]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[StudentGrade]( [EnrollmentID] [int] IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL, [CourseID] [int] NOT NULL, [StudentID] [int] NOT NULL, [Grade] [decimal](3, 2) NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_StudentGrade] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [EnrollmentID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Create the CourseInstructor table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[CourseInstructor]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[CourseInstructor]( [CourseID] [int] NOT NULL, [PersonID] [int] NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_CourseInstructor] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [CourseID] ASC, [PersonID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Create the Course table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[Course]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Course]( [CourseID] [int] NOT NULL, [Title] [nvarchar](100) NOT NULL, [Credits] [int] NOT NULL, [DepartmentID] [int] NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_School.Course] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [CourseID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Create the OfficeAssignment table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[OfficeAssignment]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[OfficeAssignment]( [InstructorID] [int] NOT NULL, [Location] [nvarchar](50) NOT NULL, [Timestamp] [timestamp] NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_OfficeAssignment] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [InstructorID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Define the relationship between OnsiteCourse and Course. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_OnsiteCourse_Course]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[OnsiteCourse]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OnsiteCourse] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_OnsiteCourse_Course] FOREIGN KEY([CourseID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Course] ([CourseID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OnsiteCourse] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_OnsiteCourse_Course]; GO
-- Define the relationship between OnlineCourse and Course. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_OnlineCourse_Course]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[OnlineCourse]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OnlineCourse] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_OnlineCourse_Course] FOREIGN KEY([CourseID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Course] ([CourseID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OnlineCourse] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_OnlineCourse_Course]; GO -- Define the relationship between StudentGrade and Course. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_StudentGrade_Course]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[StudentGrade]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[StudentGrade] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_StudentGrade_Course] FOREIGN KEY([CourseID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Course] ([CourseID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[StudentGrade] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_StudentGrade_Course]; GO
--Define the relationship between StudentGrade and Student. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_StudentGrade_Student]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[StudentGrade]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[StudentGrade] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_StudentGrade_Student] FOREIGN KEY([StudentID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Person] ([PersonID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[StudentGrade] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_StudentGrade_Student]; GO
-- Define the relationship between CourseInstructor and Course. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_CourseInstructor_Course]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[CourseInstructor]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[CourseInstructor] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_CourseInstructor_Course] FOREIGN KEY([CourseID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Course] ([CourseID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[CourseInstructor] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_CourseInstructor_Course]; GO
-- Define the relationship between CourseInstructor and Person. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_CourseInstructor_Person]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[CourseInstructor]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[CourseInstructor] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_CourseInstructor_Person] FOREIGN KEY([PersonID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Person] ([PersonID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[CourseInstructor] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_CourseInstructor_Person]; GO
-- Define the relationship between Course and Department. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_Course_Department]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[Course]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[Course] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_Course_Department] FOREIGN KEY([DepartmentID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Department] ([DepartmentID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[Course] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_Course_Department]; GO
--Define the relationship between OfficeAssignment and Person. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_OfficeAssignment_Person]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[OfficeAssignment]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OfficeAssignment] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_OfficeAssignment_Person] FOREIGN KEY([InstructorID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Person] ([PersonID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OfficeAssignment] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_OfficeAssignment_Person]; GO
trans-unit.target:
-- Create the Department table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[Department]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Department]( [DepartmentID] [int] NOT NULL, [Name] [nvarchar](50) NOT NULL, [Budget] [money] NOT NULL, [StartDate] [datetime] NOT NULL, [Administrator] [int] NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_Department] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [DepartmentID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Create the Person table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[Person]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Person]( [PersonID] [int] IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL, [LastName] [nvarchar](50) NOT NULL, [FirstName] [nvarchar](50) NOT NULL, [HireDate] [datetime] NULL, [EnrollmentDate] [datetime] NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_School.Student] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [PersonID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Create the OnsiteCourse table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[OnsiteCourse]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[OnsiteCourse]( [CourseID] [int] NOT NULL, [Location] [nvarchar](50) NOT NULL, [Days] [nvarchar](50) NOT NULL, [Time] [smalldatetime] NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_OnsiteCourse] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [CourseID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Create the OnlineCourse table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[OnlineCourse]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[OnlineCourse]( [CourseID] [int] NOT NULL, [URL] [nvarchar](100) NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_OnlineCourse] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [CourseID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
--Create the StudentGrade table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[StudentGrade]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[StudentGrade]( [EnrollmentID] [int] IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL, [CourseID] [int] NOT NULL, [StudentID] [int] NOT NULL, [Grade] [decimal](3, 2) NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_StudentGrade] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [EnrollmentID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Create the CourseInstructor table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[CourseInstructor]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[CourseInstructor]( [CourseID] [int] NOT NULL, [PersonID] [int] NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_CourseInstructor] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [CourseID] ASC, [PersonID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Create the Course table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[Course]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Course]( [CourseID] [int] NOT NULL, [Title] [nvarchar](100) NOT NULL, [Credits] [int] NOT NULL, [DepartmentID] [int] NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_School.Course] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [CourseID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Create the OfficeAssignment table. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.objects WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[OfficeAssignment]') AND type in (N'U')) BEGIN CREATE TABLE [dbo].[OfficeAssignment]( [InstructorID] [int] NOT NULL, [Location] [nvarchar](50) NOT NULL, [Timestamp] [timestamp] NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_OfficeAssignment] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ( [InstructorID] ASC )WITH (IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF) ) END; GO
-- Define the relationship between OnsiteCourse and Course. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_OnsiteCourse_Course]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[OnsiteCourse]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OnsiteCourse] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_OnsiteCourse_Course] FOREIGN KEY([CourseID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Course] ([CourseID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OnsiteCourse] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_OnsiteCourse_Course]; GO
-- Define the relationship between OnlineCourse and Course. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_OnlineCourse_Course]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[OnlineCourse]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OnlineCourse] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_OnlineCourse_Course] FOREIGN KEY([CourseID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Course] ([CourseID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OnlineCourse] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_OnlineCourse_Course]; GO -- Define the relationship between StudentGrade and Course. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_StudentGrade_Course]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[StudentGrade]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[StudentGrade] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_StudentGrade_Course] FOREIGN KEY([CourseID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Course] ([CourseID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[StudentGrade] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_StudentGrade_Course]; GO
--Define the relationship between StudentGrade and Student. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_StudentGrade_Student]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[StudentGrade]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[StudentGrade] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_StudentGrade_Student] FOREIGN KEY([StudentID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Person] ([PersonID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[StudentGrade] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_StudentGrade_Student]; GO
-- Define the relationship between CourseInstructor and Course. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_CourseInstructor_Course]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[CourseInstructor]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[CourseInstructor] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_CourseInstructor_Course] FOREIGN KEY([CourseID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Course] ([CourseID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[CourseInstructor] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_CourseInstructor_Course]; GO
-- Define the relationship between CourseInstructor and Person. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_CourseInstructor_Person]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[CourseInstructor]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[CourseInstructor] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_CourseInstructor_Person] FOREIGN KEY([PersonID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Person] ([PersonID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[CourseInstructor] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_CourseInstructor_Person]; GO
-- Define the relationship between Course and Department. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_Course_Department]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[Course]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[Course] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_Course_Department] FOREIGN KEY([DepartmentID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Department] ([DepartmentID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[Course] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_Course_Department]; GO
--Define the relationship between OfficeAssignment and Person. IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.foreign_keys WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[FK_OfficeAssignment_Person]') AND parent_object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[dbo].[OfficeAssignment]')) ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OfficeAssignment] WITH CHECK ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_OfficeAssignment_Person] FOREIGN KEY([InstructorID]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Person] ([PersonID]); GO ALTER TABLE [dbo].[OfficeAssignment] CHECK CONSTRAINT [FK_OfficeAssignment_Person]; GO

trans-unit.source: Next, copy and execute the Insert Data script.
trans-unit.target: Next, copy and execute the Insert Data script.

trans-unit.source: You now have an on-premises database that you can export to Azure.
trans-unit.target: You now have an on-premises database that you can export to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Next, you'll run a wizard that creates a .bacpac file, loads it onto Azure, and imports it into SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Next, you'll run a wizard that creates a .bacpac file, loads it onto Azure, and imports it into SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: In Management Studio, right-click the school database that you just created, point to Tasks, and click Deploy Database to Microsoft Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: In Management Studio, right-click the school database that you just created, point to Tasks, and click Deploy Database to Microsoft Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: In Deployment Settings, enter a name for the database, such as school.
trans-unit.target: In Deployment Settings, enter a name for the database, such as school.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect. To solve problems with connectivity, try this troubleshooter.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect. To solve problems with connectivity, try this troubleshooter.

trans-unit.source: In Server name, enter the 10-character server name, followed by .database.windows.net
trans-unit.target: In Server name, enter the 10-character server name, followed by .database.windows.net

trans-unit.source: In Authentication, choose SQL Server Authentication.
trans-unit.target: In Authentication, choose SQL Server Authentication.

trans-unit.source: Enter the administrator login name and password that you created when provisioning the SQL Database logical server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the administrator login name and password that you created when provisioning the SQL Database logical server.

trans-unit.source: Click Options.
trans-unit.target: Click Options.

trans-unit.source: In Connection Properties, in Connect to database, type master.
trans-unit.target: In Connection Properties, in Connect to database, type master.

trans-unit.source: Note You must connect to the master database whenever you want to create a database on the Azure SQL Database server.
trans-unit.target: Note You must connect to the master database whenever you want to create a database on the Azure SQL Database server.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: This step concludes the connection specification and takes you back to the wizard.
trans-unit.target: This step concludes the connection specification and takes you back to the wizard.

trans-unit.source: Click Next and click Finish to run the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Click Next and click Finish to run the wizard.

trans-unit.source: In Management Studio, under Object Explorer, click the Connect icon.
trans-unit.target: In Management Studio, under Object Explorer, click the Connect icon.

trans-unit.source: In the Server name box, type the name of the Azure SQL server, followed by database.windows.net
trans-unit.target: In the Server name box, type the name of the Azure SQL server, followed by database.windows.net

trans-unit.source: In Authentication, select SQL Server Authenication.
trans-unit.target: In Authentication, select SQL Server Authenication.

trans-unit.source: Enter the administrator login name and password you created when provisioning the server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the administrator login name and password you created when provisioning the server.

trans-unit.source: Click the Options button.
trans-unit.target: Click the Options button.

trans-unit.source: Click the Connect to database dropdown, and click Browse server.
trans-unit.target: Click the Connect to database dropdown, and click Browse server.

trans-unit.source: In the following dialog box, click Yes to allow browsing of the server.
trans-unit.target: In the following dialog box, click Yes to allow browsing of the server.

trans-unit.source: Click the school database to select it, then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click the school database to select it, then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Then click Connect. To solve problems with connectivity, try this troubleshooter.
trans-unit.target: Then click Connect. To solve problems with connectivity, try this troubleshooter.

trans-unit.source: Expand the Databases folder.
trans-unit.target: Expand the Databases folder.

trans-unit.source: You should see the school database in the list.
trans-unit.target: You should see the school database in the list.

trans-unit.source: Note You must connect to the database you want to query.
trans-unit.target: Note You must connect to the database you want to query.

trans-unit.source: Right-click school and click New Query.
trans-unit.target: Right-click school and click New Query.

trans-unit.source: Execute the following query to verify that data is accessible.
trans-unit.target: Execute the following query to verify that data is accessible.

trans-unit.source: For a tutorial on creating a new Azure SQL database, see <linkText>Getting Started with SQL Database Administration</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a tutorial on creating a new Azure SQL database, see <linkText>Getting Started with SQL Database Administration</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For the basics of connecting to an Azure SQL database from a C# app, see <linkText>Connect to and query your SQL Database with C#</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the basics of connecting to an Azure SQL database from a C# app, see <linkText>Connect to and query your SQL Database with C#</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more tutorials on connection from various platforms (such as PHP) see <linkText>Azure SQL Database Development: How-to Topics</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more tutorials on connection from various platforms (such as PHP) see <linkText>Azure SQL Database Development: How-to Topics</linkText><title></title>.
